headline.main: THE PRIVATEER SUMTER; Unsuccessful Cruise of the Keystone State The Powhatan Following Her to the Coast of Brazil. THE KEYSTONE STATE AT ASPINWALL

docs.lead_paragraph: The steam gunboat Keystone State, Commander SCOTT, with 140 men, arrived at Aspinwall yesterday from Surinam. She will remain at Aspinwall five or six days, and take in 350 tons of coal. She reports that the gunboat Iroquis was at St. Thomas on the 8th. The steam war ship Richmond took coals in at

docs.snippet: Because Quartermaster-Gen. MEIGS, whose resources and expedients seem as infinite as his industry, confesses weakness upon the single point of warm covering for sleeping soldiers, and begs contributions of blankets which the market cannot supply, we...
docs.lead_paragraph: Because Quartermaster-Gen. MEIGS, whose resources and expedients seem as infinite as his industry, confesses weakness upon the single point of warm covering for sleeping soldiers, and begs contributions of blankets which the market cannot supply, we are not to infer that our Army is necessarily to winter in the northern tier of the rebel States.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; IMPORTANT FROM WASHINGTON. GREAT EXTENT OF THE REBEL LINES. Their Forces Estimated at 125,000. No General Engagement Considered Probable at Present. CANNONADING HEARD UP THE POTOMAC IMPORTANT NEWS FROM MISSOURI. Energetic Preparations of Gen. Fremont. General Price's Pickets Extended to Georgetown. A GREAT BATTLE EXPECTED SOON. SPECIAL DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. THR FORCE OF THE REBELS. AN ARRIVAL FROM RICHMOND. RETURN OF SECRETARY CHASE. MORE BRIGADIER-GENERALS. THE FUNERAL OF GEN. GIBSON. CLERK APPOINTED. NO GENERAL ENGAGEMENT. HEALTH OF THE ARMY. PROPOSALS FOR BEEF. MISCELLANEOUS NEWS.
